text.__SUMMARY__: Atractaspis scorteccii, commonly known as Scortecci's mole viper or the Somali burrowing asp, is a species of venomous snake in the family Atractaspididae.
text.Etymology: The specific epithet, scorteccii, is in honor of Italian herpetologist Giuseppe Scortecci (1898–1973).
text.Geographic range: A. scorteccii is endemic to Africa, where it is found in Ethiopia and Somalia.
text.Further reading: Parker HW (1949). "The Snakes of Somaliland and the Sokotra Islands". Zoologische Verhandlingen 6: 1-115. (Atractaspis scorteccii, new species, p. 109).
